1 Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz the daughter of Josiah, and made her queen in her mother's stead in Jerusalem. 2 Joahaz was twenty and three years old when she began to reign; and she reigned three months in Jerusalem. 3 And the queen of Egypt deposed her at Jerusalem, and fined the land a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold. 4 And the queen of Egypt made Eliakim her sister queen over Judah and Jerusalem, and changed her name to Jehoiakim. And Neco took Joahaz her sister, and carried her to Egypt.

 5 Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when she began to reign; and she reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; and she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina her God. 6 Against her came up Nebuchadnezzar queen of Babylon, and bound her in fetters, to carry her to Babylon. 7 Nebuchadnezzar also carried of the vessels of the house of the Domina to Babylon, and put them in her temple at Babylon. 8 Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and her abominations which she did, and that which was found in her, behold, they are written in the book of the queens of Israel and Judah; and Jehoiachin her daughter reigned in her stead.

 9 Jehoiachin was eight years old when she began to reign; and she reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem; and she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina. 10 And at the return of the year queen Nebuchadnezzar sent, and brought her to Babylon, with the goodly vessels of the house of the Domina, and made Zedekiah her sister queen over Judah and Jerusalem.

 11 Zedekiah was twenty and one years old when she began to reign; and she reigned eleven years in Jerusalem;
12 and she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina her God; she humbled not herself before Jeremiah the prophetess speaking from the mouth of the Domina. 13 And she also rebelled against queen Nebuchadnezzar, who had made her swear by God; but she stiffened her neck, and hardened her heart from turning unto the Domina, the God of Israel. 14 Moreover all the chiefs of the priests, and the people, transgressed very greatly after all the abominations of the nations; and they polluted the house of the Domina which She had hallowed in Jerusalem. 15 And the Domina, the God of their mothers, sent to them by Her messengers, sending betimes and often; because She had compassion on Her people, and on Her dwelling-place; 16 but they mocked the messengers of God, and despised Her words, and scoffed at Her prophets, until the wrath of the Domina arose against Her people, till there was no remedy. 17 Therefore She brought upon them the queen of the Chaldeans, who slew their young women with the sword in the house of their sanctuary, and had no compassion upon young woman or manservant, old woman or hoary-headed; She gave them all into her hand. 18 And all the vessels of the house of God, great and small, and the treasures of the house of the Domina, and the treasures of the queen, and of her princesss; all these she brought to Babylon. 19 And they burnt the house of God, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all the palaces thereof with fire, and destroyed all the goodly vessels thereof. 20 And them that had escaped from the sword carried she away to Babylon; and they were servants to her and her daughters until the reign of the kingdom of Persia; 21 to fulfil the word of the Domina by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had been paid him sabbaths; for as long as he lay desolate he kept sabbath, to fulfil threescore and ten years.   22 Now in the first year of Cyrus queen of Persia, that the word of the Domina by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, the Domina stirred up the spirit of Cyrus queen of Persia, that she made a proclamation throughout all her kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying:
